displayProperties.description: Moving quickly slowly regenerates your health. Standing still slowly deals damage.
displayProperties.name: Haste

displayProperties.description: Your health is massively increased but does not regenerate. Defeating challenging combatants will recover health for you and nearby allies.
displayProperties.name: Brawn

displayProperties.description:
Dealing damage with Scout Rifles, Pulse Rifles, and Grenade Launchers gradually reduces their damage while increasing the damage of Submachine Guns and Shotguns, and vice versa. 

Other weapon types deal significantly less damage.
displayProperties.name: Oscillation

displayProperties.description: When defeated, combatants can drop explosives disguised as familiar items.
displayProperties.name: Counterfeit

displayProperties.description: Dealing damage with a Solar weapon now applies scorch to your targets, but your foes also now apply scorch to you when they deal Solar or explosive damage.
displayProperties.name: Ashes to Ashes

displayProperties.description: Landing multiple precision hits with a Primary ammo weapon empowers Special and Heavy ammo weapons. Reduces incoming damage while active.
displayProperties.name: Shot Caller

displayProperties.description: Using class abilities increases your fireteam's damage output. Reduces incoming damage while active.
displayProperties.name: Class Warfare

displayProperties.description: Melee abilities deal more damage and recharge much faster.
displayProperties.name: Brawler

displayProperties.description: Power weapons deal more damage, and more ammo is available.
displayProperties.name: Heavyweight

displayProperties.description: All Vanguard Rank point gains are increased!

displayProperties.description: Enemies have more health and are not staggered by damage.

displayProperties.description:
This playlist contains Control and Clash. When you launch, it will randomly select one of the modes for you to play.

Control: Capture the zones and defeat your opponents for points. The more zones you control, the more points you get for each opponent defeated. The team with the most points wins!

Clash: To win, defeat your opponents to score more points than them!
displayProperties.name: Quickplay 6v6 Rules

displayProperties.description: Swapping Exotic armor or ammo type in the Kinetic or Energy weapon slot drains all ability energy.
displayProperties.name: Notswap

displayProperties.description: All Crucible Rank point gains are increased!
displayProperties.name: Increased Crucible Rank

displayProperties.description: All Crucible loot drops are doubled on wins.
displayProperties.name: Double Crucible Drops

displayProperties.description: Ability Cooldowns Increased
displayProperties.name: Shaxx's Training Weights

displayProperties.description: Increased respawn times.
displayProperties.name: Longer Respawns

displayProperties.description: To win, defeat your opponents to score more points than them!
displayProperties.name: Clash Rules

displayProperties.description: Matchmaking does not utilize skill.
displayProperties.name: Matchmaking

displayProperties.description:
Capture the zones and defeat your opponents for points. The team with the most points wins.

Zone Advantage: The state when your team owns 2 zones. Your team gains +2 points for every Guardian you defeat while in this state.

Power Play: The state when your team owns all 3 zones. Your team gains +3 points for every Guardian you defeat while in this state.

Capture Participant: You gain an additional +1 point for each player that participated in the zone capture.
displayProperties.name: Control Rules

displayProperties.description: Matchmaking prefers to avoid players with widely disparate skills.
displayProperties.name: Matchmaking

displayProperties.description:
Ability recharge time: Slowed

Special ammo is earned by engaging in combat.

Special ammo is not lost on death.
displayProperties.name: Checkmate Modifiers

displayProperties.description:
To win, your team must detonate or defuse charges. Defeating the entire opposing team and being the last Guardian(s) standing will also grant victory.

Attackers: Arm the charge at one of two sites, and guard it until it detonates. Eliminating the defending team will result in winning a round.

Defenders (Arming Phase): Prevent the attacking team from arming any charges until the round ends. Eliminating the attacking team will result in winning a round. 

Defenders (Defusing Phase): Defuse the armed charge. Eliminating the attacking team will not end the round.
displayProperties.name: Countdown Rules

displayProperties.description: Spawn Cadence: Heavy ammo will spawn every round after a long duration.
displayProperties.name: Heavy Ammo Rules (Alpha)

displayProperties.description: Spawn Cadence: Heavy ammo will spawn on the third round only.
displayProperties.name: Heavy Ammo Rules (Bravo)

displayProperties.description:
To win, your team must detonate or defuse both charges.

Attackers: Arm the charge at one of two sites and guard it until it detonates. 

Defenders (Arming Phase): Prevent the attacking team from arming any charges until the round ends.  

Defenders (Defusing Phase): Defuse the armed charge.

Respawns Enabled: Defeated Guardians will respawn after a short time.
displayProperties.name: Countdown Rules

displayProperties.description:
To win, your team must become the last Guardian(s) standing by defeating the entire opposing team.

Tiebreaker: A capture zone appears when a round reaches overtime. Win the round by capturing the zone before the other team.
displayProperties.name: Elimination Rules

displayProperties.description: To win the round, reach the scoring threshold by capture zones, or capture all zones completely.
displayProperties.name: Lockdown Rules

displayProperties.description: To win, defeat your opponents to score more points than them! Your abilities recharge much faster in this mode, and final blows made with Power weapons or Supers grant additional points.
displayProperties.name: Mayhem Rules

displayProperties.description:
Capture the zones and defeat your opponents for points. The team with the most points wins. This is a faster version of Control.

Momentum: You can capture zones faster. Weapon damage is significantly increased. Abilities and Supers regenerate when you defeat an opponent. Passive regeneration is significantly decreased. 

Zone Advantage: The state when your team owns 2 zones. Your team gains +2 points for every Guardian you defeat while in this state.

Power Play: The state when your team owns all 3 zones. Your team gains +3 points for every Guardian you defeat while in this state.
displayProperties.name: Momentum Control Rules

displayProperties.description: To win, defeat your opponents to get the most points! This is a free-for-all mode where no one is an ally.
displayProperties.name: Rumble Rules

displayProperties.description: Win the match by winning more rounds than your opponents. Defeat them to score points; the team with the most points wins a round.
displayProperties.name: Showdown Rules

displayProperties.description: Defeated Guardians drop a crest. Secure opposing crests to score points. Secure allied crests to deny your opponents points.
displayProperties.name: Supremacy Rules

displayProperties.description:
To win, your team must become the last Guardian(s) standing by defeating the opposing team to exhaust their revives.

Revives: Both teams are allocated a limited pool of revives. If a team runs out of their revives, they can no longer respawn.
displayProperties.name: Survival Rules

displayProperties.description:
To win, defeat your opponents to score more points than them! Every player is equipped with a Scorch Cannon.

Scorch Cannon: A heavy-impact weapon borrowed from the Eliksni. Shots can detonate on impact or can be charged by holding and releasing the actuator for a larger explosion.
displayProperties.name: Team Scorched Rules

displayProperties.description:
To win, score more points than your opponent by capturing and controlling zones.

Zones: Score points for each zone your team controls.
displayProperties.name: Zone Control Rules

displayProperties.description:
To win, score more points than your opponent by collecting the Spark and igniting your opponent's Rift.

Spark: Spawns in the center of the map at the beginning of the match and after a team scores. Drops at the Spark Runner's location upon death. 

Rift: Each team has a Rift on their side of the map. Carry the Spark into your opponent's Rift to score. Defend your Rift from opposing Spark Runners.
displayProperties.name: Rift Rules

displayProperties.description:
This playlist contains Collision and Survival. When you launch, it will randomly select one of the modes for you to play.

Collision: To win, score more points than your opponents by capturing and controlling the zone. There will be one zone active at a time. Defeating your opponents does not directly grant points.

Survival: To win, your team must become the last Guardian(s) standing by defeating the opposing team to exhaust their revives.
displayProperties.name: Competitive Division Rules

displayProperties.description:
Complete placement matches to determine your starting position on the current Season's Ranked ladder.

Matches played: {var:4027254163} of {var:2701182729}
displayProperties.name: Placement Series

displayProperties.description:
Win 2 of the next 3 matches to be promoted to the next Rank.

Match results (W-L): {var:3036110002}-{var:2130373872}
displayProperties.name: Promotion Series

displayProperties.description:
Win 2 of the next 3 matches to avoid relegation.

Match results (W-L): {var:1550688411}-{var:3875673079}
displayProperties.name: Relegation Series

displayProperties.description: Matchmaking prefers players with similar Competitive Rank.
displayProperties.name: Matchmaking

displayProperties.description:
This playlist features three new Crucible maps: Dissonance, Eventide Labs, and Cirrus Plaza.

It features four randomized modes: Collision, Clash, Survival, and Elimination.
displayProperties.name: New Territory

displayProperties.description:
Score points by defeating your opponents with a relic.

Relics: Mysterious weapons that hold immense power. Defeat your opponents with a relic to score points for your team.

Relic Depot: Each depot can equip you with one of the following relics: Aegis Shield, Synaptic Spear, Solar Scythe.

Relic Energy: Players without an equipped relic must earn energy to gain access to the Relic Depot. Relic energy can be built up by your own actions, your team's actions, and even the opponent's actions throughout the match.
displayProperties.name: Relic Rules

displayProperties.description:
Capture and control active zones to score points. There are multiple zone locations, but only one active at a time. 

The team with the most points at the end of the match wins! Defeating your opponents does not grant points. 

Zones: Score +1 point when your team captures an active zone. Score +1 point for each time interval your team controls that zone. Captured zones will deactivate after a set amount of time and a new zone will activate elsewhere on the map.
displayProperties.name: Collision Rules

displayProperties.description: Defeated Guardians will respawn after a short time.
displayProperties.name: Respawns Enabled

displayProperties.description:
All weapons are disabled! Abilities are your only defense.

Your abilities recharge much faster, and your camera is set to third person.
displayProperties.name: Paracausal Focus

displayProperties.description:
All abilities are disabled! Weapons are your only defense.

Collect Special ammo and Heavy ammo from crates around the map.
displayProperties.name: Hardware Focus

displayProperties.description: Ammo crates spawn much more frequently, and players drop more ammo when defeated.
displayProperties.name: Havoc Rules

displayProperties.description:
When you and your ally are reunited, your weapon handling and reload speed are greatly increased, and you gain increased flinch resistance.

When you and your ally are drifting apart, your sprint and slide abilities are enhanced.
displayProperties.name: Doubles Rules

displayProperties.description: Matchmaking selects players based on character class. Each team is formed entirely of one class type.
displayProperties.name: Matchmaking

displayProperties.description: Zones capture slower, and capturing a zone immediately scores. Reduced score limits are in place for the slow capturing variant.
displayProperties.name: Slow Capturing Zones

displayProperties.description: Abilities recharge at a reduced rate.
displayProperties.name: Trickle

displayProperties.description: Players do not respawn with Special ammo.
displayProperties.name: Special Ammo Rules (Alpha)

displayProperties.description:
To win, be the first team to summon and defeat your Primeval. 

Motes: Defeated foes will drop Motes you can pick up. Watch out! If you die, you'll lose any Motes you're holding. 

Bank: Deposit Motes you're holding in the bank. Bank enough Motes, and you'll summon a Primeval. 

Blockers: Bank enough Motes at once to summon Blockers that lock the opposing team's bank. 

Invasions: As your team banks Motes, an invasion portal will open, allowing you to enter the opposing team's area. Take them out to make them drop their Motes!
displayProperties.name: Gambit Rules

displayProperties.description: This activity is currently Focused. Your score will contribute to your class's standing in the fight for glory in the Focus Activity Event.
displayProperties.name: Focused Activity

displayProperties.description: All Gambit Rank point gains are increased!
displayProperties.name: Increased Gambit Rank

displayProperties.description:
Iron Banner Rank point gains are increased by: {var:204478713}.{var:542268544}x

Challenges Completed: {var:3685276897} of 4
Iron Banner Gear Equipped: {var:3094895831} of 5
Iron Banner Emblem: {var:334376694} of 1
displayProperties.name: Iron Banner Rank Boost

displayProperties.description:
To win, rack up points by defeating your opponents. You gain more points and a boost of energy at each final blow while on a streak of 2 or more.

Streak: The number of opponents you defeat in a single life. Streaks are broken into 2 tiers called Surging and Primed that award you increasingly more points and energy at each final blow. But beware: once you become Primed, you need to keep quickly defeating your opponents or you'll erupt!

The Hunt: This activates for your team when you or your teammate is Primed by reaching a streak of 5 or more. At the start of The Hunt, the whole team gets a boost of energy.  It ends when your team has no more players Primed.
displayProperties.name: Iron Banner: Eruption

displayProperties.description:
To win, score more points that your opponent by capturing and defending the zones. The Hunt activates twice per match.

Zones: Gain 2 points for each zone your team controls at each time interval.

Zone Advantage: The state when your team controls 2 zones. Your team gains 4 points at each time interval.

Power Play: The state when your team controls all 3 zones. Your team gains 6 points at each time interval.

The Hunt: Occurs twice per match. Caiatl sends a high-value zone via Drop Pod. This zone is quick to capture and awards a large number of points over a shorter period of time.
displayProperties.name: Iron Banner: Fortress

displayProperties.description:
To win, defeat your opponents, collect their crests, and deposit them at Cabal beacons.

Cabal Beacons: Beacons appear at various locations on the map, two at a time. They have limited duration before they switch to another position. Collect crests and deposit them at beacons for points.

The Hunt: Activates when the score threshold is met. This is a limited, special state when Caiatl sends a high-value beacon protected with turrets. The high-value beacon awards a bonus score for each crest deposited.
displayProperties.name: Iron Banner: Tribute

displayProperties.description:
To win, your team must become the last Guardian(s) standing by defeating the entire opposing team or capturing the zone.

Dominion: A capture zone appears at the start of each round. Win the round by capturing the zone.

Elimination: Wins can also be achieved by defeating the opposing team.

Revives: Teammate revives are enabled.
displayProperties.name: Dominion Rules

displayProperties.description: All Trials Rank point gains are increased!
displayProperties.name: Increased Trials Rank

displayProperties.description:
When on an active Lighthouse Passage, matchmaking does not utilize skill.

When on a Trials Passage or a completed Lighthouse Passage, matchmaking prefers players with similar weekly performance in Trials of Osiris.
displayProperties.name: Matchmaking

displayProperties.description: Matchmaking selects players based on character class. Each team has one of each class.
displayProperties.name: Matchmaking

displayProperties.description:
Complete objectives and defeat high-value targets to generate data Motes.

Upon death, some collected data will drop to the ground to be reacquired.

Pick up data and deposit it to earn power-ups during encounters.

Successfully completing encounters in Expert difficulty will provide additional rewards at the end of the activity.
displayProperties.name: Arena: Breach Executable: Mode Rules

displayProperties.description:
Depositing data will award one of the following buffs:
• Chance to create Stasis Crystals on Stasis damage
• Chance to apply Scorched on Solar damage
• Chance to gain class ability energy on combatant final blows
displayProperties.name: Data Buffs

displayProperties.description:
Potential Data buffs:
• Chance to create Stasis Crystals on Stasis damage
• Chance to apply Scorched on Solar damage
• Defeated combatants have a chance to refund a portion of class ability energy
displayProperties.name: Data Buffs

displayProperties.description:
Depositing data will award one of the following buffs:
• Chance to spawn an Orb of Power on combatant final blows
• Chance to Jolt on Arc Damage
• Chance to gain melee energy on combatant final blows
displayProperties.name: Data Buffs

displayProperties.name: Overcharged Auto Rifle

displayProperties.description:
Venture into the VexNet, disrupt the Vex from accessing and locking away a treasure trove of Golden Age data, and investigate strange clues left in the network.

Enigma Protocol uses a low starting timer, requiring Guardians to move quickly and find ways to increase their time in the VexNet.

To increase your timer:
-Destroy Network Security Nodes
-Defeat Archival Timekeepers
-Unlock "Codebase Splice" Vendor Upgrades
displayProperties.name: Enigma Protocol Rules

displayProperties.description: If the timer reaches 0:00, the activity will restart.
displayProperties.name: Forced Reboot Timer

displayProperties.description: Opponent Shields Disabled
displayProperties.name: Expert Modifiers

displayProperties.description:
Defend and repair the ADU against waves of combatants. There are 10 waves to a set.

ADU: If the ADU is destroyed, the activity ends with the set.

Scraps: In-activity currency earned by scoring. Used to purchase and upgrade defenses at the start of every set and after the third and sixth waves.

Rewards: Granted on defeating a set's boss wave. Subsequent sets grant better rewards. Expert difficulty increases rewards.

Bonus Objectives: Reward resources, vendor reputation, and armaments.
displayProperties.name: Onslaught Rules

displayProperties.description: Combatant difficulty is set at a fixed level.
displayProperties.name: Power Level Disabled

displayProperties.description: Combatant power increases after each set.
displayProperties.name: Escalating Difficulty

displayProperties.description:
Activates on wave 31.

If your fireteam falls, you will be returned to orbit.
displayProperties.name: Delayed Extinguish

displayProperties.description: Scorn Raiders now have Void shields.
displayProperties.name: Raider Shield

displayProperties.description: Power is disabled in this activity. Combatant difficulty increases with each set.
displayProperties.name: Escalating Difficulty

displayProperties.description: If your fireteam falls in a Restricted Zone, everyone is returned to orbit.
displayProperties.name: Extinguish

displayProperties.description: This week, an Elder Revenant awaits you on wave 50.
displayProperties.name: Weekly Boss

displayProperties.description: This week, an Elder Revenant awaits you on wave 50.
displayProperties.name: Weekly Boss

displayProperties.description: This week, a Subjugator Omen awaits you on wave 50.
displayProperties.name: Weekly Boss

displayProperties.description: Combatants are granted random Banes.
displayProperties.name: Randomized Banes

displayProperties.description:
Successfully complete four laps in the Contest of Elders.

Warden's Judgment:  A dynamic range of values tied to the activity's difficulty. Stacks of positive Judgment are called Warden's Favor and increase encounter difficulty. Stacks of negative Judgment are called Warden's Punishment and slightly decrease difficulty. 

Warden's Sentencing: Following every reward phase, the Warden will assess the fireteam's Judgment rating. Warden's Favor allows the fireteam to skip an encounter, while Warden's Punishment activates the Punishment Protocol.

Secondary Objectives: Challenges and critical objectives appear in every encounter. Mastery of these objectives contributes toward Warden's Judgment.

Rewards: Granted upon the defeat of a boss. Subsequent laps pay out better rewards. Stacks of Warden's Favor increase your rewards even further.
displayProperties.name: Contest of Elders Rules

displayProperties.description: Limited fireteam revives. The Warden will grant additional revive tokens for each Model Prisoner defeated.
displayProperties.name: Limited Revives

displayProperties.description:
Additional modifiers are randomly selected at the start of each encounter.

Combatant power increases after each lap.
displayProperties.name: Dynamic Difficulty

displayProperties.description: If all your fireteam members fall with 0 Revive Tokens, everyone is returned to orbit.
displayProperties.name: Full Extinguish

displayProperties.description:
Complete a perfect lap of the Warden's twisted game.

Warden's Punishment: Failing to successfully complete secondary objectives will result in the Warden inflicting its punishment on the entire fireteam.
displayProperties.name: Kell's Vengeance Rules

displayProperties.description: Health Recovery is disabled, and you have significantly greater health and overshields. Healing Orbs can be occasionally found throughout the activity.
displayProperties.name: Nether Rules

displayProperties.description: Within the Dreadnaught there are numerous secrets to be found.
displayProperties.name: Secrets

displayProperties.description: All ammunition drops are significantly reduced.
displayProperties.name: Famine

displayProperties.description:
The Fireteam has limited revives. 

Pressure events will occur periodically. Complete them or die.
displayProperties.name: High Pressure

displayProperties.description:
Defeat as many bosses as possible before the countdown timer runs out.

The countdown timer pauses during preparation phases.
displayProperties.name: Activity Rules

displayProperties.description:
Receiving Rune Progress while not holding a Rune will provide one.  Further progress will charge the Rune, eventually upgrading it to higher tiers.

Consume your Rune to acquire Court Armaments.  Using a Tier 3 Rune for a Tier 1 purchase will still consume the Rune.  Plan your acquisitions with care!

Available Court Armaments rotate each day.  Look for combos that will help you complete encounters faster!
displayProperties.name: Rune Rules

displayProperties.description:
Combatants may have unique qualities indicated by a flashing effect applied to them.

These include some Augmentations which reduce incoming damage to bosses but are NOT full immunity shields.  Decide whether to try to deal damage through them, or complete the Augment objective to remove the damage reduction.
displayProperties.name: Special Augmentation Rules

displayProperties.description: Combatant difficulty increases after every other preparation phase.
displayProperties.name: Escalating Difficulty

displayProperties.description: Combatant difficulty increases after each preparation phase.
displayProperties.name: Escalating Difficulty

displayProperties.description: Taken Vandals summon their shields significantly more often.
displayProperties.name: Denial

displayProperties.description:
Stoke the bonfire!

Ignition Carriers: Glowing combatants that drop Igniters when dealt final blows.

Igniters: Objects that can be picked up and thrown into the bonfire to stoke the flames.

Bonfire: Stoke the bonfire with Igniters to make the flames grow.

Taken Interference: Taken will disrupt the bonfire throughout the activity. Defeat them to reignite the bonfire!
displayProperties.name: Bonfire Bash Rules

displayProperties.description: When close to a fireteam member, gain increased Recovery and Super regeneration.
